liebertGlobalProductsConditionsModule.name: liebertGlobalProductsConditionsModule

revisions.description: Added Surge Protection Device to lgpConditionCondenserTVSSFailure DESCRIPTION

o Expanded condtions table with new columns with a set of richer alarm/condition properties. o Added additional reference columns to conditions table to allow the same alarm to be active on multiple instances of an item.
Modified contact email address and added lgpNetworkName object.
Added support for HP release and a condition for firmware corrupt.
Added support for Liebert DS Unit.

lgpConditionsPresent.name: lgpConditionsPresent
lgpConditionsPresent.description: The present number of conditions (rows) in the lgpConditionsTable.

lgpConditionsTable.name: lgpConditionsTable
lgpConditionsTable.description: A list of condition table entries. The table contains zero, one, or many rows at any moment, depending upon the number of conditions in effect. The number of rows in the table is given by (lgpConditionsPresent). The table is initially empty at agent startup. The agent creates a row in the table each time a condition is detected and deletes that row subject to the following rules: Rows are removed from the table based on the following rules: 1. If a condition does not require acknowledgement (see 'lgpConditionAckReq') the condition is removed as soon as the issue clears (see 'lgpConditionCurrentState'). 2. If a condition requires acknowledgement (see 'lgpConditionAckReq') the condition is removed as soon as the issue clears (see 'lgpConditionCurrentState') AND the condition is acknowledged (see 'lgpConditionAcknowledged'). 3. If the columns 'lgpConditionCurrentState' and 'lgpConditionAcknowledged' are not present for the condition then the condition will be removed as soon as the issue causing the condition clears. The agent creates the first row with lgpConditionId equal to 1, and increments the value of 'lgpConditionId' each time a new row is created, wrapping to the first free value greater than or equal to 1 when the maximum value of lgpConditionId would otherwise be exceeded. The number of rows in the table at any given time is reflected by the value of 'lgpConditionsPresent'.

lgpConditionEntry.name: lgpConditionEntry
lgpConditionEntry.description: This entry defines the contents of the rows for the table 'lgpConditionsTable'. A row in this table cannot be created or deleted by SNMP operations on columns of the table.

lgpConditionId.name: lgpConditionId
lgpConditionId.description: A unique identifier for a condition. This value must remain constant between agent initializations. This OID is used as an index to identify a row in the table 'lgpConditionsTable'.

lgpConditionDescr.name: lgpConditionDescr
lgpConditionDescr.description: A reference to a condition description object. The object referenced should not be accessible, but rather be used to provide a unique description.

lgpConditionTime.name: lgpConditionTime
lgpConditionTime.description: The value of sysUpTime when the condition occurred (became active).

lgpConditionTableRef.name: lgpConditionTableRef
lgpConditionTableRef.description: This object will be included as a varbind in some rows of the table. It is a reference to a table object in the MIB. The value of this object will be the OID of a table that the object that the condition applies to is defined. The table row corresponding to this object will also contain a varbind 'lgpConditionTableRowRef' that will specify which instance (row) in the referenced table the object is defined in. Example: TABLE ROW: lgpConditionId 5 lgpConditionDescr lgpConditionRcpBranchBreakerOpen lgpConditionTime 393884848 lgpConditionTableRef lgpPduRbTable lgpConditionTableRowRef lgpPduRbEntryId.1.4 lgpConditionType alarm lgpConditionCurrentState active lgpConditionSeverity major lgpConditionAcknowledged acknowledged lgpConditionAckReq required In the above example the breaker opened for a Receptacle branch. The specific receptacle branch is specified by the additional varbind (lgpEventParmTableRowRef). In this case the notification is for the 4th receptacle branch on the 1st PDU in the cluster.

lgpConditionTableRowRef.name: lgpConditionTableRowRef
lgpConditionTableRowRef.description: This is a reference to the (cell) in the table specified by the companion varbind (lgpConditionTableRef) in this condition. The row in the table where this cell exists represents the object that this condition applies to. Example: TABLE ROW: lgpConditionId 5 lgpConditionDescr lgpConditionRcpBranchBreakerOpen lgpConditionTime 393884848 lgpConditionTableRef lgpPduRbTable lgpConditionTableRowRef lgpPduRbEntryId.1.4 lgpConditionType lgpConditionCurrentState active lgpConditionSeverity major lgpConditionAcknowledged acknowledged lgpConditionAckReq required The table containing the definition of the receptacle branch (lgpPduRbTable) is given by the varbind (lgpConditionTableRef) The specific receptacle branch (instance) is specified by the varbind (lgpConditionTableRowRef). In this case the condition is for the 4th receptacle branch on the 1st PDU in the PDU cluster. If one wanted to retrieve the serial number for this receptacle branch the OID would be: lgpPduRbEntrySerialNum.1.4.

lgpConditionType.name: lgpConditionType
lgpConditionType.description: The type of condition in this row in the table.

lgpConditionCurrentState.name: lgpConditionCurrentState
lgpConditionCurrentState.description: Indication of the current state of the event. If the state is 'active' then the condition currently exists. If the state is 'inactive' then the condition no longer exists (i.e. the situation causing the condition has cleared or been resolved). The behavior of some devices is to remove the condition from this table when the condition clears. The behavior of other devices is to leave the condition entry in the table until the condition is acknowledged ( see lgpConditionAcknowledged and lgpConditionAckReq).

lgpConditionSeverity.name: lgpConditionSeverity
lgpConditionSeverity.description: This represents the relative severity of the condition.

lgpConditionAcknowledged.name: lgpConditionAcknowledged
lgpConditionAcknowledged.description: This indicates if the condition has been acknowledged. If the value is 'notAcknowledged' then the condition has not been acknowledged. If the value is 'acknowledged' then the condition has been acknowledged. Writing a value of 'acknowledged' to this object acknowledges the condition and the value will be changed to 'acknowledged'. If the current state of the condition is 'active' (see lgpConditionCurrentState) the condition will, for all devices remain in the table regardless of the state of the 'lgpConditionAcknowledged' object. If the 'lgpConditionAckReq' is 'notRequired' or this column does not exist for the row then this object has no affect on the duration the condition stays in the lgpConditionsTable. If the 'lgpConditionAckReq' is 'required' then the condition will remain in the condition table until both the 'lgpConditionCurrentState' is 'inactive' AND 'lgpConditionAcknowledged' is 'acknowledged'.

lgpConditionAckReq.name: lgpConditionAckReq
lgpConditionAckReq.description: This indicates if the corresponding condition does or does not require user acknowledgement. Conditions that require user acknowledgement will have a value of 'required'. Those conditions that do not require user acknowledgement will have a value of 'notRequired' or in some devices the column may not be present at all. If a condition requires acknowledgement it will remain in the table until both the 'lgpConditionCurrentState' and 'lgpConditionAcknowledged' are 'inactive' and 'acknowledged' respectively (see lgpConditionAcknowledged). If a condition does not require acknowledgement it will be removed from the table as soon as its 'lgpConditionCurrentState' is 'inactive'.

lgpConditionControlEventReset.name: lgpConditionControlEventReset
lgpConditionControlEventReset.description: Event Reset Command. This command will reset all of the device's events. On some units, when an event is activated, a 'set' field is also marked and maintained even when the event has become inactive. The 'set' field is only cleared when the user clears it and the event is no longer active. This item will clear the 'set' field for all events that are not active.

lgpConditionControlEventAck.name: lgpConditionControlEventAck
lgpConditionControlEventAck.description: Event Acknowledge Command. This command will acknowledge all of the device's events.

lgpConditionControlTable.name: lgpConditionControlTable
lgpConditionControlTable.description: A list of condition control table entries. The table contains zero, one, or many rows at any moment, depending upon the number of conditions that are controllable by the unit. This table does not necessarily contain all conditions supported by the unit. This table only contains conditions that are end-user modifiable.

lgpConditionControlEntry.name: lgpConditionControlEntry
lgpConditionControlEntry.description: This entry defines the contents of the rows for the table 'lgpConditionControlTable'. A row in this table cannot be created or deleted by user initiated SNMP operations on columns of the table.

lgpConditionControlIndex.name: lgpConditionControlIndex
lgpConditionControlIndex.description: This is the index indicating the nth element of the table.

lgpConditionControlDescr.name: lgpConditionControlDescr
lgpConditionControlDescr.description: A reference to an Object Identifier (OID) representing a unique condition. The referenced OID is used solely for identification purposes. The object identifier referenced here will be the same object identifier referenced in the lgpConditionsTable (column: lgpConditionDescr) when the condition is activated.

lgpConditionControlEnableStatus.name: lgpConditionControlEnableStatus
lgpConditionControlEnableStatus.description: The value in this column determines if the device is currently capable of generating this event. If the value is 'enabled' then the event will be generated if the condition indicated by lgpConditionControlDescr becomes active. If the value is 'disabled' the device will never generate the event. This value is stored on the managed device. Some devices do not allow write access to some entries in this column. The 'lgpConditionControlEnableCapability' column indicates whether this entry can be written.

lgpConditionControlType.name: lgpConditionControlType
lgpConditionControlType.description: The 'type' assigned or configured for this condition. The value assigned to the condition here is displayed in the lgpConditionsTable (column: lgpConditionType). For some units this is user configurable. This value is stored on the managed device.

lgpConditionControlEnableCapability.name: lgpConditionControlEnableCapability
lgpConditionControlEnableCapability.description: Some devices do not allow write access to some entries in the 'lgpConditionControlEnableStatus' column. This column indicates whether the 'lgpConditionControlEnableStatus' entry for this row can be written.

lgpConditionDescription.name: lgpConditionDescription
lgpConditionDescription.description: The ASCII text description for the condition.

lgpNetworkName.name: lgpNetworkName
lgpNetworkName.description: The network name in a node.domain.com like format. This object is intended to be used as a varbind object by other notifications that have a context of a network address. As an example the lgpAgentDnsLookupFailure trap which describes a network name that is failing or has failed to be resolved from a Domain Name Service (DNS) lookup. Refer to RFC 952 for further information.

lgpConditionLowTemperatureExternalAirSen.name: lgpConditionLowTemperatureExternalAirSensorA

lgpConditionLowTemperatureSupplyAir.name: lgpConditionLowTemperatureSupplyAir

lgpConditionNoOnOffPermissions.name: lgpConditionNoOnOffPermissions

lgpConditionPeerNetworkFailure.name: lgpConditionPeerNetworkFailure

lgpConditionPeerNetworkDiscovered.name: lgpConditionPeerNetworkDiscovered

lgpConditionCondensatePumpHighWater.name: lgpConditionCondensatePumpHighWater

lgpConditionGeneralAlarm.name: lgpConditionGeneralAlarm
lgpConditionGeneralAlarm.description: The system has detected a general alarm condition.

lgpConditionProductSpecific.name: lgpConditionProductSpecific
lgpConditionProductSpecific.description: The system has detected a product specific condition. This condition is not currently available via the agent card.

lgpConditionReheatLockout.name: lgpConditionReheatLockout
lgpConditionReheatLockout.description: The system has locked out the electrical reheat operation for a specified amount of time.

lgpConditionHumidifierLockout.name: lgpConditionHumidifierLockout
lgpConditionHumidifierLockout.description: The system has locked out the humidifier operation for a specified amount of time.

lgpConditionCompressorsLockout.name: lgpConditionCompressorsLockout
lgpConditionCompressorsLockout.description: The system has locked out compressor operation for a specified amount of time.

lgpConditionCallService.name: lgpConditionCallService
lgpConditionCallService.description: The system has detected a condition that requires a service representative be contacted.

lgpConditionLowMemoryGroup.name: lgpConditionLowMemoryGroup
lgpConditionLowMemoryGroup.description: This group contains various low memory conditions.

lgpConditionLowMemory1.name: lgpConditionLowMemory1
lgpConditionLowMemory1.description: The system has detected a low memory condition. The control board is low in memory resources.

lgpConditionUnitCode18OutOfRange.description: The system has detected a unit code error. This digit of the unit code value is out of range.

lgpConditionHighExternalDewPoint.name: lgpConditionHighExternalDewPoint
lgpConditionHighExternalDewPoint.description: The system has detected a high external dew point condition. The room dew point has exceeded the specified threshold.

lgpConditionHcbDisconnected.name: lgpConditionHcbDisconnected
lgpConditionHcbDisconnected.description: The system has detected the humidifier control board is disconnected or not installed.

lgpConditionBmsResetTimerExpired.name: lgpConditionBmsResetTimerExpired
lgpConditionBmsResetTimerExpired.description: The BMS fan speed control reset counter has timed out.

lgpConditionAgentFirmwareCorrupt.name: lgpConditionAgentFirmwareCorrupt
lgpConditionAgentFirmwareCorrupt.description: The firmware update to the agent card has failed and the firmware is now corrupt.

lgpConditionSystemAccessGroup.name: lgpConditionSystemAccessGroup
lgpConditionSystemAccessGroup.description: This group contains various system access conditions. An examples is an open access panel.

lgpConditionFrontAccessOpen.name: lgpConditionFrontAccessOpen
lgpConditionFrontAccessOpen.description: The system has detected the front access panel/door is open.

lgpConditionRearAccessOpen.name: lgpConditionRearAccessOpen
lgpConditionRearAccessOpen.description: The system has detected the rear access panel/door is open.

lgpConditionsDamperFailure.name: lgpConditionsDamperFailure
lgpConditionsDamperFailure.description: This group contains various damper failure conditions.

lgpConditionEmergencyDamperFailure.name: lgpConditionEmergencyDamperFailure
lgpConditionEmergencyDamperFailure.description: The system has detected an emergency damper failure. The damper is in the wrong position.

lgpConditionCondenserFailureGroup.name: lgpConditionCondenserFailureGroup
lgpConditionCondenserFailureGroup.description: This group contains condenser failure conditions.

lgpConditionCondenserTVSSFailure.name: lgpConditionCondenserTVSSFailure
lgpConditionCondenserTVSSFailure.description: The condenser Transient Voltage Surge Suppressor or Surge Protection Device has failed.

lgpConditionHumidifierCyclinderWorn.name: lgpConditionHumidifierCyclinderWorn
lgpConditionHumidifierCyclinderWorn.description: The system has detected the humidifier cylinder is worn.

lgpConditionUnderCurrent.name: lgpConditionUnderCurrent
lgpConditionUnderCurrent.description: The system has detected a low current condition. The current of one or more sources in the system has fallen below a threshold for a specified amount of time. The threshold and time that triggered this condition is system dependent.

lgpConditionHumidifierUnderCurrent.name: lgpConditionHumidifierUnderCurrent
lgpConditionHumidifierUnderCurrent.description: The system has detected a low current condition on the humidifier. The current of the humidifier has fallen below a pre-determined threshold for a defined amount of time.

lgpConditionInputUnderCurrent.name: lgpConditionInputUnderCurrent
lgpConditionInputUnderCurrent.description: There is a low current condition on the input power source. The current of the input power source has fallen below a pre-determined threshold for a defined amount of time.

lgpConditionHeatRejectorGroup.name: lgpConditionHeatRejectorGroup
lgpConditionHeatRejectorGroup.description: This group contains failure conditions for the heat rejection unit.

lgpConditionHeatRejectorFanFailure.name: lgpConditionHeatRejectorFanFailure
lgpConditionHeatRejectorFanFailure.description: The heat rejecter fan has failed.

lgpConditionHeatRejectorVoltageSuppressi.name: lgpConditionHeatRejectorVoltageSuppressionFailure
lgpConditionHeatRejectorVoltageSuppressi.description: The heat rejecter voltage suppression has failed and is no longer able to protect the unit from power fluctuations.

lgpConditionFreeCoolLockout.name: lgpConditionFreeCoolLockout
lgpConditionFreeCoolLockout.description: The free cooling capability has been disabled.

lgpConditionWaterLeakSensorFailure.name: lgpConditionWaterLeakSensorFailure
lgpConditionWaterLeakSensorFailure.description: The sensor used to detect water leaks is not connected or has failed.

lgpConditionNoLoadDetectedWarning.name: lgpConditionNoLoadDetectedWarning
lgpConditionNoLoadDetectedWarning.description: There is no load detected on the output. This can be an indication that the output is being powered by an external bypass source and has inadvertently been left on external bypass. This warning is triggered after a delay. The delay is specified by the object 'lgpPwrNoLoadWarningDelay'. The alarm is triggered when the output current falls below a certain threshold specified by the object 'lgpPwrNoLoadWarningLimit'

lgpConditionFirmwareGroup.name: lgpConditionFirmwareGroup
lgpConditionFirmwareGroup.description: Grouping level for firmware related conditions.

lgpConditionFirmwareUpdateRequired.name: lgpConditionFirmwareUpdateRequired
lgpConditionFirmwareUpdateRequired.description: The firmware on the system or one or more components of the system must be updated. This typically indicates that one or more components of the system contain corrupted firmware or the firmware on one or more components are incompatible with one another. When this condition is active the system may not be able to function to its full capacity or may not be able to function at all.

lgpConditionTestGroup.name: lgpConditionTestGroup
lgpConditionTestGroup.description: Objects in this group of conditions are related to testing or test events. This object is never active.

lgpConditionTest01.name: lgpConditionTest01
lgpConditionTest01.description: This is a 'test' condition. It is a generic test event that can be utilized to evaluate system handling of events. Some products will support the activation of this event upon user request so that user management stations can execute end-to-end event handling tests.

lgpConditionReceptacleBranchGroup.name: lgpConditionReceptacleBranchGroup
lgpConditionReceptacleBranchGroup.description: Grouping level for receptacle branch conditions.

lgpConditionRcpBranchFailure.name: lgpConditionRcpBranchFailure
lgpConditionRcpBranchFailure.description: The receptacle branch module or control system has failed. Service is required.

lgpConditionRcpBranchBreakerOpen.name: lgpConditionRcpBranchBreakerOpen
lgpConditionRcpBranchBreakerOpen.description: The receptacle branch breaker is open.

lgpConditionInputUnqualified.name: lgpConditionInputUnqualified
lgpConditionInputUnqualified.description: The input is not qualified to provide power to the system. This may be due to system input over-voltage, system input under-voltage, system input frequency out of range, or other similar issues.

lgpConditionBypassUnavailable.name: lgpConditionBypassUnavailable
lgpConditionBypassUnavailable.description: This summary event is asserted when the bypass is not available. Possible causes include: Bypass Sync Error, Bypass Line Fail, Bypass Overvoltage, Bypass Undervoltage, Bypass Phase Rotation Error, or other similar causes.

lgpConditionAutoTransferFailed.name: lgpConditionAutoTransferFailed
lgpConditionAutoTransferFailed.description: The system is failing to automatically transfer the load to the alternate source.

lgpConditionSBSUnavailable.name: lgpConditionSBSUnavailable
lgpConditionSBSUnavailable.description: A Static Bypass Switch (SBS) Failure has been detected. Possible causes include: SBS Phase Open, SBS SCR (Silicon Controlled Rectifier) Shorted, SBS Overload Exceeded, Bypass Power Supply Fail, Static Bypass Switch Fuse Failure, or other similar causes.

lgpConditionSBSOverload.name: lgpConditionSBSOverload
lgpConditionSBSOverload.description: On at least one phase of the static bypass switch (SBS), the power dissipation limit has been exceeded.

lgpConditionExcessPulseParallel.name: lgpConditionExcessPulseParallel
lgpConditionExcessPulseParallel.description: The system has performed too many pulse parallel operations within the specified time interval. A pulse parallel operation is a momentary operation of the static bypass switch (SBS) in parallel with the inverter.

lgpConditionRemoteBypassSwitchOffExt.name: lgpConditionRemoteBypassSwitchOffExt
lgpConditionRemoteBypassSwitchOffExt.description: The static bypass switch is off due to the state of an external signal.

lgpConditionManTransferInhibited.name: lgpConditionManTransferInhibited
lgpConditionManTransferInhibited.description: Manual transfer from inverter to bypass is inhibited. Bypass is not qualified.

lgpConditionManReTransferInhibited.name: lgpConditionManReTransferInhibited
lgpConditionManReTransferInhibited.description: Manual retransfer from bypass to inverter is inhibited.

lgpConditionBatteryChargeError.name: lgpConditionBatteryChargeError
lgpConditionBatteryChargeError.description: The battery is not charging properly. Some reasons for this condition include, but are not limited to: battery charger failure, battery failure, etc.

lgpConditionBatteryChargeReducedExt.name: lgpConditionBatteryChargeReducedExt
lgpConditionBatteryChargeReducedExt.description: A reduced battery charging algorithm is being used due to an external signal.

lgpConditionBatteryCapacityLow.name: lgpConditionBatteryCapacityLow
lgpConditionBatteryCapacityLow.description: The battery capacity is low. Some reasons for this condition include, but are not limited to: a battery is offline, the battery age has reduced its capabilities, etc.

lgpConditionBatteryTempImbalance.name: lgpConditionBatteryTempImbalance
lgpConditionBatteryTempImbalance.description: The temperature difference between two batteries in the system exceeds the predefined threshold.

lgpConditionBatteryEqualize.name: lgpConditionBatteryEqualize
lgpConditionBatteryEqualize.description: The rectifier output voltage has been increased to equalize the battery voltage level.

lgpConditionBatteryChargeInhibitedExt.name: lgpConditionBatteryChargeInhibitedExt
lgpConditionBatteryChargeInhibitedExt.description: Battery charging is inhibited due to an external inhibit signal.

lgpConditionServiceExtBatteryMonitorGrou.name: lgpConditionServiceExtBatteryMonitorGroup
lgpConditionServiceExtBatteryMonitorGrou.description: This group contains battery monitor service conditions.

lgpConditionServiceExtBatteryMonitor1.name: lgpConditionServiceExtBatteryMonitor1
lgpConditionServiceExtBatteryMonitor1.description: External battery monitor 1 indicates battery maintenance is required.

lgpConditionServiceExtBatteryMonitor2.name: lgpConditionServiceExtBatteryMonitor2
lgpConditionServiceExtBatteryMonitor2.description: External battery monitor 2 indicates battery maintenance is required.

lgpConditionBatteryGroundFault.name: lgpConditionBatteryGroundFault
lgpConditionBatteryGroundFault.description: Battery system ground fault amperage exceeds the threshold.

lgpConditionBatteryLowShutdown.name: lgpConditionBatteryLowShutdown
lgpConditionBatteryLowShutdown.description: With the battery breaker closed, the battery voltage has dropped below the calculated End-Of-Discharge (EOD) limit.

lgpConditionEmergencyPowerOffLocal.name: lgpConditionEmergencyPowerOffLocal
lgpConditionEmergencyPowerOffLocal.description: The system has detected an Emergency Power Off (EPO) condition. The local EPO switch has cut off the power source to the system.

lgpConditionOutputLowPFLagging.name: lgpConditionOutputLowPFLagging
lgpConditionOutputLowPFLagging.description: The system has detected a lagging output power factor below the threshold, resulting in reduced load capacity.

lgpConditionOutputLowPFLeading.name: lgpConditionOutputLowPFLeading
lgpConditionOutputLowPFLeading.description: The system has detected a leading output power factor below the threshold, resulting in reduced load capacity.

lgpConditionOutputToLoadFault.name: lgpConditionOutputToLoadFault
lgpConditionOutputToLoadFault.description: The system has detected an output to load fault. This could be caused by over or under voltage, or by over or under frequency.

lgpConditionInvRestartInhibitedExt.name: lgpConditionInvRestartInhibitedExt
lgpConditionInvRestartInhibitedExt.description: Restart of the inverter is inhibited by an external signal.

lgpConditionInverterShutdownOverload.name: lgpConditionInverterShutdownOverload
lgpConditionInverterShutdownOverload.description: The system has shutdown the inverter due to a sustained overload. This event does not indicate if the load has been dropped or transferred to bypass. At least one phase of the inverter power dissipation limit has been exceeded.

lgpConditionInverterOffExt.name: lgpConditionInverterOffExt
lgpConditionInverterOffExt.description: The inverter is off due to the state of an external signal.

lgpConditionInputContactGroup.name: lgpConditionInputContactGroup
lgpConditionInputContactGroup.description: The system has detected an active input contact.

lgpConditionInputContact01.name: lgpConditionInputContact01
lgpConditionInputContact01.description: The system has detected that input contact 1 is active.

lgpConditionInputContact02.name: lgpConditionInputContact02
lgpConditionInputContact02.description: The system has detected that input contact 2 is active.

lgpConditionInputContact03.name: lgpConditionInputContact03
lgpConditionInputContact03.description: The system has detected that input contact 3 is active.

lgpConditionInputContact04.name: lgpConditionInputContact04
lgpConditionInputContact04.description: The system has detected that input contact 4 is active.

lgpConditionInputContact05.name: lgpConditionInputContact05
lgpConditionInputContact05.description: The system has detected that input contact 5 is active.

lgpConditionInputContact06.name: lgpConditionInputContact06
lgpConditionInputContact06.description: The system has detected that input contact 6 is active.

lgpConditionInputContact07.name: lgpConditionInputContact07
lgpConditionInputContact07.description: The system has detected that input contact 7 is active.

lgpConditionInputContact08.name: lgpConditionInputContact08
lgpConditionInputContact08.description: The system has detected that input contact 8 is active.

lgpConditionInputContact09.name: lgpConditionInputContact09
lgpConditionInputContact09.description: The system has detected that input contact 9 is active.

lgpConditionInputContact10.name: lgpConditionInputContact10
lgpConditionInputContact10.description: The system has detected that input contact 10 is active.

lgpConditionInputContact11.name: lgpConditionInputContact11
lgpConditionInputContact11.description: The system has detected that input contact 11 is active.

lgpConditionInputContact12.name: lgpConditionInputContact12
lgpConditionInputContact12.description: The system has detected that input contact 12 is active.

lgpConditionInputContact13.name: lgpConditionInputContact13
lgpConditionInputContact13.description: The system has detected that input contact 13 is active.

lgpConditionInputContact14.name: lgpConditionInputContact14
lgpConditionInputContact14.description: The system has detected that input contact 14 is active.

lgpConditionInputContact15.name: lgpConditionInputContact15
lgpConditionInputContact15.description: The system has detected that input contact 15 is active.

lgpConditionInputContact16.name: lgpConditionInputContact16
lgpConditionInputContact16.description: The system has detected that input contact 16 is active.

lgpConditionRectifierOperInhibited.name: lgpConditionRectifierOperInhibited
lgpConditionRectifierOperInhibited.description: The operation of the rectifier is inhibited by an external signal.

lgpConditionBypassBackFeedBrkrOpen.name: lgpConditionBypassBackFeedBrkrOpen
lgpConditionBypassBackFeedBrkrOpen.description: The bypass backfeed breaker is in the open position.

lgpConditionAutoRestartInProgress.name: lgpConditionAutoRestartInProgress
lgpConditionAutoRestartInProgress.description: Auto restart is in progress. Becomes inactive when auto restart completes or fails.

lgpConditionAutoRestartInhibitedExt.name: lgpConditionAutoRestartInhibitedExt
lgpConditionAutoRestartInhibitedExt.description: Auto restart is inhibited due to an external signal.

lgpConditionInputOnGenerator.name: lgpConditionInputOnGenerator
lgpConditionInputOnGenerator.description: A generator is supplying the power to the system.

lgpConditionInputFilterCycleLock.name: lgpConditionInputFilterCycleLock
lgpConditionInputFilterCycleLock.description: The input filter disconnect has opened too many times within a given period of time.

lgpConditionServiceCodeActive.name: lgpConditionServiceCodeActive
lgpConditionServiceCodeActive.description: The system is in an operational mode intended for testing. In normal operating conditions, the system should not be in this state.

lgpConditionLoadBusSyncActive.name: lgpConditionLoadBusSyncActive
lgpConditionLoadBusSyncActive.description: Load Bus Sync Operation is active. This synchronizes the UPS output with the output of another UPS.

lgpConditionLoadBusSyncInhibited.name: lgpConditionLoadBusSyncInhibited
lgpConditionLoadBusSyncInhibited.description: The system has detected that conditions to perform Load Bus Sync Operation are not satisfied.

lgpConditionControlsResetRequired.name: lgpConditionControlsResetRequired
lgpConditionControlsResetRequired.description: A controls reset is required because one or more critical settings have changed.

lgpConditionEquipTempSensorFailed.name: lgpConditionEquipTempSensorFailed
lgpConditionEquipTempSensorFailed.description: A temperature sensor is reporting a value outside the bounds of a properly operating sensor.

lgpConditionInputCurrentImbalance.name: lgpConditionInputCurrentImbalance
lgpConditionInputCurrentImbalance.description: The current on one input phase is much greater or lower than the average current of all the phases. This may indicate improper operation of the rectifier or input filter.

lgpConditionPumpGroup.name: lgpConditionPumpGroup
lgpConditionPumpGroup.description: The system has detected an alarm with one of the pumps.

lgpConditionPumpFlowLoss.name: lgpConditionPumpFlowLoss
lgpConditionPumpFlowLoss.description: The system has detected a loss of flow with one or more pumps.

lgpConditionPump1FlowLoss.name: lgpConditionPump1FlowLoss
lgpConditionPump1FlowLoss.description: The system has detected a loss of flow with pump 1.

lgpConditionPump2FlowLoss.name: lgpConditionPump2FlowLoss
lgpConditionPump2FlowLoss.description: The system has detected a loss of flow with pump 2.

lgpConditionPumpShortCycle.name: lgpConditionPumpShortCycle
lgpConditionPumpShortCycle.description: The system has detected a short cycling of the pumps. One or more of the pumps has been turned on and off a number of times within a specified time period.

lgpConditionPumpInverterShortCycle.name: lgpConditionPumpInverterShortCycle
lgpConditionPumpInverterShortCycle.description: The system has detected a short cycling of one or more pump inverters and has temporarily locked out further pump operation to protect from thermal overload. A short cycle is defined as powering on and off a number of times over a set time period.

lgpConditionPump1InverterShortCycle.name: lgpConditionPump1InverterShortCycle
lgpConditionPump1InverterShortCycle.description: The system has detected a short cycling of the inverter for pump 1 and has temporarily locked out further pump operation to protect from thermal overload. A short cycle is defined as powering on and off a number of times over a set time period.

lgpConditionSensorsNotDisplayed.name: lgpConditionSensorsNotDisplayed
lgpConditionSensorsNotDisplayed.description: The number of sensors that can be displayed (monitored) on the device has exceeded the pre-determined limit. Note this condition differs from the lgpConditionTooManySensors in that the system may currently have less than the maximum of installed sensors present but one or more of those sensors can not be displayed because the display order table (lgpPduAuxMeasOrderTable) contains entries for sensors that are not currently installed. This condition effectively prevents one or more installed sensors from being presented in the lgpPduAuxMeasTable. It is possible for both this condition and the lgpConditionTooManySensors condition to be active at the same time.
